comments.commentBody: Right you are, dan. And westie: do you think "matching pair" means you need to have one of each color? (It seems so from your reply.) It means two of the SAME color.

Right you are, bubbabigly.

And Hilda: why wouldn't socks of the same color be a match? That is what matching means, not to have socks of different colors.

I thought the question was extremely simple. Then I see people write "they could be of the same color" as if that wouldn't be a match. Maybe that's the rub here, that people start erroneously thinking you need one of each, which would be true if there were ten left and ten right socks, but not when there are ten of each color.

Note: the question doesn't say that some are right and some are left socks, so presumably each sock can be carried on any foot.

PeteCT

Yeah, I'm sure your resume includes stuff like Harvard Law review,

***
While Obama's accomplishments are quite impressive they very often involve reaching a pinnacle but failing to distinguish himself once there. For example, no published Law Review articles, voting "present" 130 times, etc.

He has reached the highest office in the country, but he is still expected to perform well there.

Obama is a ju-jitsu politician, using the force of his opponent to defeat him. With the Congress, after showing the country he was trying to be conciliatory with the Party of Cynicism, he allowed them to paint themselves into a very small far-right corner, which has defined the platform and the Romney candidacy. In the debate, he let Romney Etch-a-Sketch himself as a moderate. Now Romney is trapped in the contradiction between his previous strategy and his current re-make, which Obama will use—starting in Denver today—to show Romney the Flip-Flopper, the Cynic, trying to fool one constituency after another into voting for him. This will illuminate the GOP as the POC—the Party of Cynicism, doing anything to get elected so they can repeal not just Obamacare, but the New Deal as well, control the law through their SCOTUS, reduce taxes on the rich and reduce regulations on business.

The Party of Cynicism is now set-up for a crushing defeat, which Obama will effect by showing how toxic they are to democracy.

I'm not worried yet.  This is the President's true nature; and the country got to see the other guy in his true setting (if he has one):  dictatorial, makes his own rules, expects everyone else to listen to him.  In the end, Obama will be a little more 'hungry' and Mitt will be a litte over confident.  Now THAT could be entertaining!
The tortoise won the race because the rabbit was shot by the NRA members who support Romney.  Something like that happened at the debate, too.
Do you rembember the story of the tortoise and the rabbit?

"A panel will need to decide what happens to this elderly person who has become penniless. "

Nope, that's not what would happen. When the $ runs out, the nursing home would call the elderly patient's family and demand that they take her home, regardless of the family's ability to care for an elderly and possibly demented or seriously ill patient. If there is no family available, they'd dump them at a local hospital at the first credible sign of illness -- and then refuse to take them back when the hospital is ready to discharge them. The impoverished, ill elderly would end up in the most expensive care setting possible -- hospital beds -- and the cost of caring for them will be spread out across paying customer.

In this way, a problem that Republicans don't want to acknowledge will get "privatized," with family members who genuinely cannot care for their elderly family member blasted with guilt and lectures about responsibility, and the rest of us paying higher medical bills to cover placing the elderly ill in expensive, inappropriate settings.

It's not the Democrats, but rather the Republicans who want Death Panels. Often it is the accuser, who projects his/her views on another. With a significant cut to Medicaid, when many of our seniors living in nursing homes run out of money (a $100,000/year is not an unusal expense) a panel will need to decide what happens to this elderly person who has become penniless. The panel having insufficient medicaid funds to assist will be forced to deny coverage. The panel might as well approve a cocktail of meds to end life. This scenario is far too possible with the cuts proposed by Romney/Ryan. And, why? Because we can't cut military spending or ask the wealthy to pay more or ...? The Republican Party, sadly, justifies the contributors (tax payers) and shows no mercy on the poor (who likely paid taxes in their younger years). It's as unChristian and inhuman as you can get.

"Romney...takes away the people's leverage with the behemoth medical-industry players."
Eureka! Now I see it. Thank you Jumper.
By giving people vouchers and letting them negotiate on their own they will be using the same strategy as busting up unions and forcing workers to negotiate on their own. It's diabolical!

"Perhaps in time the ACA will morph into something more efficient and less costly such as single payer."

Interesting. Can you think of an example of a costly government program morphed into a less-expensive program over time?
Pathological liar!! Check it out, Romney has all the symptoms!

A major part of the U.S. health care problem is the costs and rate of cost increases.

The Affordable Care Act at least applies a variety of brakes to the rising costs and health insurance costs. Perhaps in time the ACA will morph into something more efficient and less costly such as single payer.

The Romney/Ryan plan allows government turn a blind eye to healthcare costs and rising healthcare and health insurance costs.For Medicare, Romney/Ryan would give Medicare recipients vouchers and tell them they're on their own. It takes away the people's leverage with the behemoth medical-industry players.

Romeny's false statement was worse than a joke in bad taste. He was intentionally deceiving the public because he knows voters wouldn't support the dire straits into which his plan would throw them. Romney's proposal would allow tens of millions to be denied health insurance, shorten life expectancy, decrease quality of life, increase pain and suffering, and force people to spend a lifetime living with intense healthcare anxiety.

All the major industrial nations have resolved this healthcare issue - except the U.S. Not in the U.S., though! In the U.S., we're fighting tooth-and-nail to keep the minimal start we have from being destroyed by a charlatan trying to con voters to substitute a short and brutal existence for healthcare.

Dr.,
Can't speak for Nate, but the instant polls the terrible 10 pt. , InTrade decline, and the almost unanimous journalistic and public dismay at Obama's stuttering, muttering, inchoate responses to clear prevarications he must have expected -- we all did -- suggest that Romney has picked up 2-3 pts. and perhaps more. That huge shift erases some leads, as in No. Carolina and perhaps VA, and endangers several others, Ohio, FL, etc..

Obama has gone from a pleasantly rising slope leading to a massive or comfortable victory to a sharp decline, one must assume, that may be leading toward a tie or worse. His decision or surrender to to be indecisive was stupid, at best. He has given away an almost insurmountable lead with one night's torpor. He was a contendah, now he's headed to a House of Representative's loss of office He owed so many hurting people who had backed him so much.

squidboy6, Santa Barbara

"The war that Romney wants with Iran..."

****
Since when does taking a firm stand equal a desire for war? Talk about lies. It's about as farfetched as saying Obama wants us to be invaded.

Speaking of cruel practices... Bill collection in the ER is one practice that would vanish in a world where single-payer is the law of the land.

The Times reported on this earlier this year. The case has been settled. http://www.nytimes.com/2012/04/25/business/debt-collector-is-faulted-for...
Cynical is the best word to describe the overriding sentiment of most Americans. That is the current American Spirit.
Didn't we already elect that guy in '68?

Maybe, in this latest iteration of the game Lucy plays tricking Charlie Brown with the football, Romney really is completely sincere, a closet moderate after all.  It would be totally irrelevant to what he would do in office because if he has any hope of getting renominated he will have to spend four years doing exactly what the tea party and Senator Inhofe and Jim DeMInt and Darryl Issa tell him to do, just as John Boehner (who may be the soul of moderation personally) does.

"The crucial test will be whether Romney can develop, brand and sell this approach over the campaign’s final month."

Why would anyone buy the more sellable Romney without assurance that this is the Romney that the country would get if he were elected? Which Romney product would we get? The pragmatic, reasonable one from last night, the rabid "severely" conservative one from the Republican primaries, the arrogant plutocrat of the "47%" remark, or some yet to be revealed product?

The fact that he is playing clever word games to avoid explaining how his proposed tax cuts will be revenue neutral and result in deficit reduction is indicative of the Romney product that we will get if we elect him: a secretive, manipulative and cynical leader.
This is spot on.  Thank God Obama will be reelected.  I guarantee it!

Exactly. Romney bullied the moderator,insisted on having the last word throughout the 90 minutes and for all his insistence on needing to speak, he repeated himself so often that it was just plain boring.
In defense of Obama and the moderator, it is very tough to deal with a bully with grace in front of a national audience, esp when you have serious answers and serious questions.
The moderator should have been better prepared to deal with this. It is the first debate. The next moderators may prepare for this now that they've seen it. I think they need to come in with more specific questions and make a point of testing the candidates.

Obama got almost FOUR MINUTES MORE speaking time during the debate, so there's no excuse for him in not fighting back.

People here need to stop making excuses for Obama's performance last night. Even Al Gore said it was probably the altitude that caused it.

The blame for Obama's poor performance lies solely at his own feet.

It's difficult to summon enthusiasm when the person debating you buries you in a series of lies, and you have 2 minutes to address them.

Mr. Romney came prepared with his lies (and possibly a "crib sheet," which is SUPPOSED to be against the rules; check what he does after the opening handshake), and the President came prepared to answer those lies.......... but not when they came four, five, even six at a time.

And not when the ref stepped into his layup shots all night, ignored the elbows being thrown to the eye, and was bullied by the other player into ignoring both rudeness and condescension.

As for the "winner"... well, given that most of today has been spent reading about all Mitt Romney's lies....

I'd say the President came out pretty well.

David:

Among all the comments below, only one referred to a scientific study. That study was done using driving simulators. The last time I looked (3 years ago), every single study was done using simulators, not real-world driving. That is not surprising, because a real world driving test would be too expensive for any university to conduct, not to mention controlling for variables (traffic rates, unpredictable situations, gender, ago, smoking, visual acuity, subject of conversation....). Instead, we get healthy university students. Biased sampling is what it is called, or to be polite, hypothesis generating.

Does anyone really believe -intuitively- that talking hands-free to a machine is just as risky as talking to passengers, including controlling a bunch of raucous kids? Talking on hand-helds not the same as eyes off the road

The zero-tolerance guy wrote: "The truth is that distracted driving kills and maims, no matter what level, e.g. hands-free talking, etc. It’s been proven. The numbers are in." Well, the numbers are not in, all those studies have preliminary conclusions, none based on real-world driving.

I smell pious assumptions by people who rigidly think that all risks are equal.

Serial liars have no problem looking people in the eye; but people who know they're being lied to, avoid looking at the liar.

See for yourself, the next time someone knowingly lies to YOU, how "comfortable" you are.

You are so correct. Before the election of our current tea party Governor in Florida. We used to try to preserve wilderness for future generations and for clean water and air. But now all Florida is concerned with is generating instant cash.
I see, you'd rather that we didn't drill for oil, that what oil there was available cost $100/gallon, and that most people would walk.
Not my comment to the previous writer. I totatlly agree with you. It is really scary to think what the supreme court will be also, should these fanatics win.

Romney is shameless, a prevaricator and shape shifter. I am concerned about his glee in promoting more drilling, opening more federal lands to his confederates in the energy industry, bringing in the XL pipeline with little or no regulation.

For those who care about the future of our planet and leaving it in at least as good a condition as we have found it for future generations, an elected Romney would guarantee the wholesaling of our treasured lands for the enrichment of the favored elite, the 1%.
Mr. Romney also did not mention that Democrats passed that bill WITHOUT Mr. Romney.
Laszlo - You would prefer Susan SARANdon?
But, John, people constantly call those tournaments you mention "Opens," and unless you're in the know there's no way to tell if the reference is to golf or tennis.
Please no!!!

Okay, it's a Patrick Berry and we know his grid will be smooth and the clues misdirecting. But I have some news for him. The ORANGE BOWL is not a game. The game is football. The ORANGE BOWL is the venue. The teams do not play ORANGE BOWL. They play football in the ORANGE BOWL. Bad clue. Bad boy.

Now I will wait until Martin tells me why the clue is okay even if it is not okay.

I just noticed that I misread the lab results- where I thought it said the urine screen for amphetamines was negative (at the bottom of page 2 of labs), the "Neg" is referring to normal reference value, not to the result. The reported result is beside it - "Note" - but I don't actually see the Note anywhere. Maybe it is ecstasy??
Statin overdose leading to acute kidney and liver damage, and rabdomyolysis (high CK)
this is MDMA intoxication and water intoxication.  Tube (looks like they did), MICU.

Central Pontine Myelinolysis from the hyponatremia/SIADH. Likely seized along the way, CK & WBC in absence of fever is from prolonged seizure, not sure what the original insult (MDMA? Mushroom?) but this is the result.

She was likely intubated because of her altered mental status.  Patients with a GCS of 8 or less need to be intubated for airway protection.  If someone can't protect their airway and they vomit, they're at high risk for aspiration.  An aspiration pneumonia can be fatal pretty quicly.
I think she was given an overdose of GHB, either by the "friend" or someone else, and subsequently suffered a myocardial infarction.
The most salient piece of data here seems to be the elevated thyroxine. Agree with posters looking along the hypopituitary/adrenal axis.
